reference: Benko, Robert P., Protecting Intellectual Property Rights (Washington, DC: American Enterprise Institute), 1981.
Caves, Richard E., Multinational Enterprise and Economic Activity (Cambridge, England: Cambridge University Press), 1982.

Chin, Judith C. and Gene M. Grossman, Intellectual Property Rights and North-South Trade, in Ronald, W. Jones and Anne 0. Krueger (eds.), The Political Economy of International Trade: Essays in Honor of Robert E. Baldwin - (Cambridge, MA: Basil Blackwell), 1990.
Diamond, Peter A., An Alternative to Steady-State Comparisons, Economics Letters 5: 7-9, 1990.
Deardorff, Alan V., Welfare Effects of Global Patent Protection, Economica 59: xx-xx, 1992.
Diwan, Ishak and Dad Rodrik, Patents, Appropriate Technology, and North-South Trade, Journal of International Economics 30: 27-47, 1991.
Feinberg, R.M. and D.J.Rousslang, The Economic Effects of Intellectual Property Rights Infringements, Journal of Business 63: 79-90, 1990.
Mansfield, Edwin, Raw Rapidly Does New Industrial Technology Leak Out? Journal of Industrial Economics 34: 2 17-223, 1985.
Mansfield, Edwin, Schwartz, Mark, and Wagner, Samuel, Imitation Costs and Patents: An Empirical Study. The Economic Journal 91: 907-918, 1981.

Maskus, Keith E., Normative Concerns in the International Protection of Intellectual Property Rights, The World Economy 13: 387-409. Maskus, Keith E. and Denise E. Konan, Trade-Related Intellectual Property Rights: Issues and Exploratory Results, University of Colorado, mimeo, 1991.
